object.name: setMyCommands
object.description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See this manual for more details about bot commands. Returns True on success.
object.html_description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See this manual for more details about bot commands. Returns True on success.
object.rst_description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See `this manual <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#commands>`_ for more details about bot commands. Returns :code:`True` on success.

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.
annotations.name: commands

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to :class:`aiogram.types.bot_command_scope_default.BotCommandScopeDefault`.
annotations.name: scope

annotations.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands
annotations.html_description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands
annotations.rst_description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands
annotations.name: language_code
